definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: With the waiting depot, the arriving coffin, and the somber faces.
sentences.chinese: 这里是停柩所，是已运到的棺木，和无数阴沉的脸面。

sentences.english: More guards, carrying six wooden coffins, made their way to a wall on the prison's seaward side.
sentences.chinese: 又有几个守卫扛着六具棺木朝监狱靠海的一面墙走去。

sentences.english: In China, coffins made of cardboards were available.
sentences.chinese: 在中国可以买到硬纸板制成的棺木。

sentences.english: Damdeok stands in front the coffin.
As well as fragments of coffin wood and nails, there were four press studs.
sentences.chinese: 另外，除了棺木碎片和钉子以外，还有四个揿扣。

sentences.english: The pallbearers are carrying out the casket.
By contrast, the British media has regularly covered the return of coffins.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，英国媒体对运回棺木的报道已经习以为常。

sentences.english: Oh, their coffins are escorting by armed police officers off the plane.
sentences.chinese: 噢，武警正在护送他们的棺木走下飞机。

sentences.english: I bend down, and touch lightly with my lips the white face in the coffin.
sentences.chinese: 弯身，以唇轻触那棺木中苍白的面容。

sentences.english: A decorative wood podium was placed behind Tom’s coffin.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的棺木后面放着一个装饰性的木质讲台。

sentences.english: The caskets can be dispatched to buyers within 48 hours.
sentences.chinese: 棺木可以在买家下单后48小时内派送。

definition: to prepare a dead body for coffin
to put dead body in coffin
